Reviews.Title: “Clean, Kind and Basic”
Reviews.Author: whereintheworld45
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a good location and offered a clean room, and kind service. Only a few blocks from Pimlico Station and about a 7 minute walk to Victoria Station, this hotel was perfect for the relaxed weekend we planned to explore the city and take in the theatre. The staff was very kind, welcoming us with a smile, offering information, and taking care of our blocked shower drain quickly and efficiently. Our rooms were clean, and the beds were comfortable. Breakfast was fine. Simple toast, cereal and eggs. It is next door to a youth hostel, but we did not hear any noise. (Maybe this was because we stayed there in the winter and people were not out on the terrace?) Overall, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: salamander627
Reviews.Content: A small and friendly hotel, in a very good location, the No.24 bus stops almost opposite and takes you up to the West-end and theatre land. Our room was clean and warm, the staff friendly and helpful. As other people have mentioned the breakfast room is very small for the amount of guests but if you are able to get a table the breakfast is good. We found it very good value for money and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, but noisy neighbours!”
Reviews.Author: JLSinger
Reviews.Content: Despite some of the negative reviews I've seen for this hotel, I mainly chose it because of the location and the price. Arriving at the hotel, I was impressed by its location, only 10 mins walk from Victoria tube, and on a beautiful street, with lots of impressive Victorian terraces. Inside the hotel, I was allocated Room 3, which was in the basement. I was somewhat dubious but my room was actually lovely, really clean with a wonderfully modern and clean ensuite. Despite booking for a single room I was given a family room which had a double bed and a single bed, with lots of floor space which was ideal! The room had a nice new TV, tea and coffee facilities as well as a full length mirror which being a girl, I appreciated!! The only negative thing I have to say about the hotel was the noise at night. I was down in London for an interview so had somewhat of a restless sleep anyway because of nerves, but the noise that was made by other guests was the main contributor! At one point, I thought the guest next door was in the room with me, I could hear him that through the walls! I would say that if you are staying there because of business, just to be aware the noise could be disturbing, but if you are looking for somewhere reasonable for fun break in the city, then this would be perfect! If I need a hotel in London, I would certainly be back!

Reviews.Title: “Would have been great if we werent in the basement”
Reviews.Author: guestfrombrighton
Reviews.Content: First impressions of the hotel were good: clean reception, friendly receptionist, nice area, ideal location. I was a little disappointed with room 5 as it was very small but the sheets were clean and the shower was amazing so overall felt we had got a good deal considering location. I noticed we were directly opposite the breakfast room but didnt think anything of this at the time as it was a closed off space....How noisy can tea and croissants be anyway???.. VERY is the answer. What we werent told when we checked in was that a door in the hall next to our room which we thought was a cupboard was infact a makeshift kitchenette and the staff began noisily clattering crockery and cutlery at 7.30 on SUNDAY morning right outside our bedroom door!! that was bad enough but when the breakfast room opened inconsiderate guests were running up and down the hallway shouting about the lack of bacon. I was really looking forward to a good nights sleep after a great night out on the tiles but sadly after being woken up i couldnt get back to sleep due to the high levels of noise. Even after complaining to reception the kitchen staff continued to be noisy and after an hour we could take more and checked out in a rage - all this before 9.30am - not the chilled out morning i had been hoping for. I am still so disappointed with my stay as it started so well and this experience did make a bad ending for an otherwise brilliant weekend away. I would still recommend this hotel to friends as it is good value BUT i would suggest if, like me, u like lazy sunday mornings, avoid the basement at all costs especially room 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for London's West End!”
Reviews.Author: MFLZ
Reviews.Content: I would like to add my recommendation to those of other lodgers who have stayed at the Victoria Inn. It is situated within easy walking distance from Victoria Station where a 30 minute train ride gets you to or from Gatwick throughout the day and most of the night. Bus No.24 stops meters away from the hotel and this takes you right to the heart of the West End's Theatre land. Bus No.2 and others also stop nearby and these ferry you across to Marble Arch, Oxford Street.. etc for easy shopping. What more can you ask for? :) The Hotel itself is very friendly and the staff were all very polite and helpful. There is a lift to the rooms and the standard of cleanliness is impeccable.Hot water, showers, TV, kettle and appliances all 100% functional and the complimentary coffee and tea in the room most welcome. The beds were comfortable and the room very warm. Owing probably to its good reviews the Hotel was pretty full and perhaps a bit too full at breakfast time and breakfast itself could be a little more varied perhaps but it is sufficient and good for the price. We would certainly look it up again next time we're in Town and do not hesitate to recommend it as a first class platform to visit London.

Reviews.Title: “Basic”
Reviews.Author: DeborahPage79
Reviews.Content: Clean room, small sized. Good location (5 min walk from Pimlico). Friendly welcome. Cannot comment on breakfast as both mornings we went down all (seven?) tables were taken! Food did not look overly exciting anyway so do not feel like we missed out.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Chulinya R
Reviews.Content: The staff is very helpfull and nice. The bedroom is clean and every day we had clean towels. Breakfast is good. Minor detail: some more sandwich filling. Otherwise very good hotel. \the location is very nearby Victoria station, Pimlico station and shops. See you next time.

Reviews.Title: “Will return”
Reviews.Author: ladyniamh
Reviews.Content: Top class! Description:We really enjoyed our stay at Victoria Inn and will return in the future. The staff were helpful. We stayed in room no 12, it appeared newly refurbished, the shower was excellent. The breakfast was tasty and there was much variety to chose from. We checked in/out painlessly and could leave our bags whilst waiting for our flight. The reception lady even printed out our boarding pass for us. nothing was too much trouble. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Quick Visit to London”
Reviews.Author: eangelm
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel because of the location and ease of getting to and from various appointments in London. Approximately a 10 minute walk to Victoria Station, but apart from this there are various bus stops around and the hotel is also near to the Victoria Coach depot. The room was basic, but clean, as was the ensuite shower/toilet facility. The latter would appear to have been recently refurbished. Although I booked a double room, I was given a triple. One less bed would have given more space, so if there were 3 people staying in the room, moving around would have been difficult. However, I suspect that all the rooms are somewhat cramped. There were tea/coffee making facilities in the room as well as a hair-dryer. Value for money for a London hotel it was good. Breakfast was included, but in my view not worth having. The breakfast area is cafeteria style and very cramped. The staff was helpful and friendly and there was always somebody on duty.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, friendly and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: fabtravel55
Reviews.Content: Room was lovely and clean and had everything I required. Even soap / shower dispensers and hairdryer inc. It was also comfortable, modern decor and TV and quiet. Although not huge, it was entirely adequate for my requirements and staff were very helpful in directing me to somewhere to eat in the evening. Very handy for Pimlico tube and nearby meeting venues. Breakfast was continental but plentiful and good variety, including meat and cheeses. I didn't check to see if there was WiFi, as I had my own connection. All in all this was excellent value and more personable than a larger hotel. I will certainly return here if I need to be in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms and small breakfast area”
Reviews.Author: elkss
Reviews.Content: Rooms quite small and basic but you get what you pay for! Breakfast area was very nice but could be very cramped if busy, No major concerns was in the middle of clearly being refurbished when we stayed, so hopefully this is now finished

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay here again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Charlene B
Reviews.Content: I was dreading staying here after reading these reviews and all I can say is how WRONG they were!!! The staff could not have been any friendlier or any more helpful. The room (number 12) yes it was basic but it was very clean and the bathroom was newly refurbished. All the bed linen was clean and fresh, the same as the towels - extra pillows and towels produced immediately upon request. Kettle and facilities in the room and enough storage space for a short break away. Even a TV all working channels....what more do you want from a room when you are in Central London a walk away from everywhere?????? As for the Continental breakfast, yes the breakfast area was busy but what do you expect when everyone gets up at the crack of dawn? We went down 15 minutes before the end of serving and everything was still available. it wasnt just coffee and tea, there was a hot drinks machine that catered for all (including my hot chocolate addiction :-0). Croissants, 3 different breads, toaster, 3 types of cereal, cheese, jams, boiled eggs, 3 different fruit juices, fruit...... I would most definately stay here again - if you expect more than what you pay for do yourself a favour and pay the price and book into a Hilton. Well done and Thank you to the staff at the Victoria Inn :-)

Reviews.Title: “OK for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: TizzyWYorks_England
Reviews.Content: Good location 5 mins from Pimlico tube station in a nice looking street. Room was basic but clean 7 modern with a spotless bathroom. Walls are quite thin so heard the French people chatting next door. Continental breakfast is a little chaotic with all residents in a very small room. Food counter could have been better thought out but we had sufficient to eat. No issues with the lift to 5th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy grubby hotel never go there again”
Reviews.Author: kathy186402
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my short break at The Victoria a place I would not recommend to anyone! We arrived at the Victoria on Monday evening at 10.45pm and was given a key to a Triple room No.34 on the second floor, I was staying there with my two daughters just for one night, I decided to to take a shower before bed as we had a long in London I entered the bathroom all seem well until I looked at the toilet and was shocked and disgusted to see it hadn't been cleaned properly and the previous occupant had obvously had a very bad stomach upset as there was excrement all over the bottom part of the lid and where the lid is attached to the toilet Photos attached, I tried to phone down to reception but I couldn't get the phone to work, so I went down to reception and asked to be moved to a new room, I was told the hotel was full and there was no rooms left, I asked for the housekeeper to come and clean the toilet, I was told there wasn't anyone on site until the following morning, I asked to speak to the manager who surprise surprise wasn't there! I asked the receptionist to come and look and he declined he did apologise but said there was nothing he could do and the manager would be back in the morning, I was so cross and frustrated had it not been so late and such a scary night in London (due to riots taking place) I would have left and found accommodation elsewhere, I returned to the room and decided to use the towel to cover the back of the toilet, I then noticed that the toilet roll roll holder was broken and came off the wall (this was also covered in excrement), the whole place felt filthy, When we arrived at the hotel I was asked to sign a disclaimer stating that I would agree to pay Â£50 to deep clean the room if we did not leave it as we found it! What a joke This spoilt what was meant to be a treat we couldn't wait to get out the place! The following morning in the cold light of day we could see the whole room was a bit grubby, we went down for breakfast to the smallest dinning area, we was asked by a lady if she could help us and I said yes if she could find us a table and chairs (and was told rather rudely that the dinning area had been open since 7.30 and we should have come down then) we didn't stay for breakfast and went to look for the manager, at reception the same man from the night before was there with a lady whom i thought was the manager (turns out she wasn't the manager was still at home and they had no idea when she would be in) but they did speak to her on the phone while we were there and she offered us Â£20 compensation! I was enraged! but was told we stayed the night (I did point out that we had no choice due the lateness and rioting within the city) I told them I was looking for a full refund of Â£165 as this was a horrendous overnight stay in the hotel which I would never recommened to anyone and I also said that I would be contacting yourseleves for a full refund and leaving my review on tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible !”
Reviews.Author: ginger143
Reviews.Content: Room tiny and cramped, no seating or dressing table. Wardrobe space was laughable! No information pack in the room. No safety fittings on 3rd floor window. Most worryingly was the lack of fire evacuation procedures! The only upside was the great location. Stayed at the Days Inn hotel directly across the street, at just an extra Â£10 per night it was a far more pleasurable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - everything we needed”
Reviews.Author: PercysPet
Reviews.Content: Welcoming reception area and staff. Check in and out very easy. We were in 2 basement rooms opposite the restaurant but it did not disturb me. Double room fine for single occupancy - yes the rooms are small but very clean and comfortable. En suite very clean and brilliant shower. The hotel seemed newly refurbished. Restaurant a little cramped but adequate and continental breakfast was adequate. We only wanted somewhere to sleep after busy days and evenings and for the price it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Good budjet in London, next time to repeat it”
Reviews.Author: HelderBCarvalho
Reviews.Content: This was my first time on a 3 star hotel, so we were with our expectancys very low. The hotel is very central, just 5/7 minutes from Victoria station. The hotel is very small, but the room was ok, simple but convenient. Breakfast was very simple and the room was small, but we went there with a baby stroller. If you like to walk, it isn't far from Hyde park corner, as well as Big Ben, and on theses places you can go to almost every other important parts in London. For the price, you have breakfast included, you have a confortable room and a very central hotel. i booked directly on the hotel's site.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: clairehenning
Reviews.Content: We booked this room last minute and was more than happy with it. The room although was on the small side was very clean and comfortable. Perfect for an overnight stay. The staff were all very helpful and polite. The continental breakfast was plentyful with choices of cereal / toast / fruit & bread rolls etc and a wide variety of drinks. Please remember you are booking a budget hotel and paying a budget price ... so don't expect the ritz !

Reviews.Title: “Cramped but convenient”
Reviews.Author: robjhyndman
Reviews.Content: The location is great. It is possible to walk to Westminster Abbey in less than 20 minutes, and to the nearest Tube station (Pimlico) in about 10 minutes. It is also reasonably priced given the location. However, be prepared to be cramped, even by English standards. The door to our bathroom couldn't open more than half way because the bed was in the way and the breakfast room was so claustrophobic that we gave up eating there. The wifi (at 2 pounds per hour) worked fine from the lobby but not in our room.

Reviews.Title: “We be back as soon as possible!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: elinaRethymno
Reviews.Content: Very good service, only poor breakfast ,The rooms are very small but really clean .The staff is excellent , smile and helpfull.Very good situation in the heart of the London.The rates of the hotel very normal and accetable.Certainly I will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Victoria Inn: Kind of Eh...”
Reviews.Author: collegejournalistjc
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here while backpacking, and we thought it would be a great hotel in the midst of hostels...turned out our expectations were way too high. The location is great and the service is good, but there is no air conditioning and the walls are paper thin. We sweat all night and could hear our neighbors quite clearly. (And our room was right by the maid's room so we woke up every morning at 7:30 without fail when they started making breakfast and chatting....not too pleasant) They didn't give washcloths for some reason, and breakfast was nothing but cornflakes and toast. (no protein but small cheddar cheese slices to sustain you through the day.) It wasn't bad, but I wish that we had stayed somewhere else. ps. wifi is expensive and shoddy.

Reviews.Title: “Not 3 star!!!”
Reviews.Author: travel_nut10UK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 2 family members for a 2 night break a few nights ago. I was a bit doubtful when booking it and was even searching for a new hotel the night before we were due to stay here!! The website is exceptionally misleading. The hotel looks NOTHING like the pictures. The outside building is shabby and run down, the sign has even fallen off the wall. Check-in wasn't a fabulous experience - it took a long time with the receptionsit faffing around, deciding which room was clean and then trying for 15 mins to find us a key card! The room was so tiny, you literally could not turn sideways without hitting off a bed or a wall. The room was for suitable for 1 person rather than 3. Again, the room was nothing like the website - the walls were in desperate need of paint and the sheets needed a wash. The room stank of cigarettes and air freshener - not good. The bathroom was very small with no air con so every time the shower went on it was like a sauna. The only thing going for this hotel is the location. It's pretty central to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: LuchySwanwick
Reviews.Content: Friendly reception staff. Very clean room. Very good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad At All”
Reviews.Author: Ridgewaylass
Reviews.Content: Previously read reviews made me doubt the decision to book our 5 night stay here. Our contact with the hotel was always friendly and excellent. We were too early to check in but were allowed to leave our cases in the reception with a locked rope. When we finally checked in we found our room to be clean with a modern bathroom and more than adequate space for three of us. Room 34 is at the back of the hotel and quiet. You do hear other guests on the stairs and in their rooms but I didn't feel it was intrusive. The hotel is an easy short walk to Pimlico tube station. Breakfast is taken in the basement and the room is basic and functional. On offer is toast, cereals, bread rolls and croissants, cheese and plenty of juice and hot drinks. All perfectly fine. There may be a queue for seat but that is because everyone wants to eat at the same time, while queuing there will be guests taking ages chatting etc, the breakfast is fine but not worth relaxing over! We were too eager to start our day in London to linger.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: southerncross187351
Reviews.Content: We actually booked a hostel next door. But my mum was not allowed to sleep there cause she is older then 35 years! We did not know that so we had no bed for our short trip in london! The lady @ the rezeption was friendly and gave us a discount! It was clean, friendly, in the middle of london! Breakfeast was awesome. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Under refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: G H G
Reviews.Content: We Stayed in this hotel 28-30 Jan 2011 location quiet and easy reach from Victoria coach/train stations. Our room, 27, very small but clean and modern shower, it did lack shower gel - but beds comfortable and clean albeit cramped- as there were a double and single beds- The public areas very tired and breakfast room under refurbishment ,the continental breakfast was poor and the seating situated in the reception area! cramped and difficult to pass between tables. Staff friendly and willing, we had to ask for heating to be turned on when we arrived this happened instantly. I think once all the areas of the hotel have completed the refubishing then this old hotel building we be fine. Until then think elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: AtlBets
Reviews.Content: Easy walk from Victoria Station, convenient to tube and bus. If you are expecting a true English breakfast, you will be disappointed, it was a "continental" breakfast. But we knew that going in, so it was not a problem for us. Our only complaint is that our triple room was the size of a double. Put 3 adults in the room, with their suitcases, and there was NO room to walk. Apparently there is a larger triple room, so be sure to ask for that one! Bathroom was great, updated. Our room was quiet, we were on the backside of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: gls09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on New years eve and don't understand what all the complaints are for. Very clean, spacious room. We had number 6, 3 people shared this room comfortably. Breakfast was as we expected and just what is needed to set you up for the day. We will use this hotel again without doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: markandliz101
Reviews.Content: We were a bit concerned about some of the reviews we read on here as we'd stopped here about 5 years ago and it appeared to have gone a bit downhill since our last stay....we needn't have been worried though because the room we were in had been totally upgraded. There were complete new fittings in the shower room (toilet, sink, tiles, shower cubicle) and the room in general had been completely redecorated and contained all new fixtures and fittings (new furniture, sockets and tv). We were supplied with tea and coffee making facilities but pity they didn't supply a couple of biscuits as that was the only thing I could fault about the hotel! Pity it wasn't free wifi but I always take a mobile broadband stick so it didn't matter to me that much. Free wifi would definitely be an advantage for the hotel though. The breakfast area is a little too small if you are unlucky enough to have everyone descend for breakfast all at once and you're then relying on people to be sensible in that situation and not all crowd round at once as it just blocks everything up. A few of us waited for a few people to clear before getting our breakfast but that's beyond some people I suppose! Anyway, all in all. it's a lovely little hotel at a decent price for the centre of London. There are plenty of eateries and pubs if you don't want to stray too far on an evening and if you do want to go a little further then everything is still within walking distance. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: Happy_TravellerWigan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in room 55 on the top floor. the room was not large, but enough space to move around and hang clothes etc. As we intended to be out most of the time a large room was not essential to us. The room was clean, the bed comfortable, the extra pillows requested supplied, clean towels each day, a spotless ensuite facility that had been recently renovated. the facilities in the room (TV, hairdryer, coffee making facility) all worked. Heating more than adequate - thermostatic radiator valve and opening windows ensured that we slept well. Breakfast in the basement breakfast room was simple (cereal, fruit juice, toast, jam, cheese) but included in the price (and all you could eat as well!) - you could order a cooked breakfast for an extra payment but no one seemed to. The staff were friendly, the area quiet with some good restaurants nearby, especially the Queens Head pub. At Â£81 per room per night including breakfast I think we found a bargain and would certainly go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Only 10 minutes walk from Big Ben”
Reviews.Author: TravelMore78
Reviews.Content: Very small hotel on the prettiest street near the city centre! Only 10 minus walk to Big Ben, 10 minus walk from Victoria railway station and 20 minus walk from the Buckingham Palace. Great location! The street is very beautiful and calm. But the hotel itself is very small and the service is not very good. We did not have sockets in the room and no ventilation.

Reviews.Title: “could do better with that price! but clean and okey for JUST one night!”
Reviews.Author: mimaUK
Reviews.Content: I chose it as it didnt have any reviews about bugs and insects, so that was a relief. you walk in and there is still wet pain on the walls and doors, I was given a dounstairs room with 3 beds and just realised it was right opposite the busy road, knowing my very light sleeping I asked to change the room, the lady changed it streightaway, so that was a bonus. breakfast was disgustin, tap water, very cheap toast , cereals and absolutely no more choice! and atmosphere was very gloomy and stuffy, so yea I could'v skipped the breakfast and avoided a bad experience and for 5 pounds breakfast should be GOOD! I paid 80 pounds for the night, I didnt think it was worth it. However, the room was clean compared to other places Iv been, but towels were dry and not soft, carpet was not vacuumed properly. Bathroom was clean but smelled funny, also shower gel dispenser was empty!! the receptionist in the afternoon told me I can leave my bag however it'd be my responsibility if I lose it!!!!!!!!!! thankfuly It was still there, the other lady was surprised as to why her colleague didnt let me leave the bag in a private place! to sum up, I would be happy to go back again with all my personal shower stuff and breakfast, for 1-2 nights, making sure to take ear plugs if I paid Â£50-Â£60 otherwise SHOP AROUND FIRST!

Reviews.Title: “Embarrassed to be British!”
Reviews.Author: picperfic
Reviews.Content: Sadly this is not to be a good review....the hotel has an impressive faÃ§ade, however that is where the excitement ended for us. Admittedly there is decorating work going on, for which allowances were made in our opinions of the hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful but hardly dressed to impress. The whole reception area was cluttered, even a steam iron was set up ready to use in the background!! There was a distinct grubby air about the Victoria Inn. I found myself saying to my husband that I was embarrassed at how this type of Hotel portrays our capital city to the rest of the world. Surely to have a Hotel in London is something to be proud of?!? Expensive because of the location, yet sadly the style and care is somewhat lacking when compared to hotels of a similar price range in other European Cities. When we first entered our room, we were welcomed by what we assumed was an unflushed toilet, not nice!! However, after several uses of the toilet we realised that the plumbing was to blame as previously flushings seemed to reappear a few moments later. Eugh! The plug in our sink got stuck so water would not drain away, washing of hands became difficult and so we used the shower instead of the sink to do this, which was not an easy task. The shower was a good shower though! We did tell reception on our way out on the second day. When we returned the sink had been emptied of water but the plug was still firmly in place so yet again, nothing would drain away. I presume that the ancient 'Henry' cleaner outside our bedroom door was used to suck away anything left in the sink? As for the breakfast, well I didn't even venture down to the stuffy dining room on the 2 mornings we were there. Bad coffee and equally bad breakfasts leave me in a bad mood and I felt unable to take the risk so I chose to get my breakfast elsewhere, even though it was included in the price of the room. My husband however, decided to brave it and went downstairs, returning a while later with the comment 'you made a wise choice in not having breakfast here!' The restaurant was tiny, cramped and 'locked' down in the basement. No windows - just recirculated burnt toast air! Coffee was close to unpalatable, it was only because my husband was thirsty did he drink it! He had chocolate the next morning... A good English breakfast is neither difficult nor expensive to create and would really boost a Hotel's business, so why do we get offered such cheap and nasty food and drinks? Hardly a good selling point for you.... So all in all I am embarrassed by the whole experience, being a budget hotel should not mean grubby and inefficient with a cheap and nasty breakfast. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, such a shame as I really would have enjoyed the 2 nights so much more, had a bit more effort and care been apparent. I find it insulting to my intelligence that the owner of The Victoria Inn Hotel feels comfortable treating people so badly. Visitors must surely come to London from all over the world, and come to stay in hotels like this one. Wouldn't it be far more cost efficient to get good reviews or perhaps the owners are happy to have visitors come to stay just once? I imagine that they must be happy with their turnover, people book the room, feel sad and disappointed but then move on, never to return. No wonder the rooms have to be paid for in advance with no cancellations, no one would want to pay the full price after staying in such a sad and grubby hotel..! We stayed on the 9th & 10th September 2010

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value For Money But Bring Your Ear Plugs.”
Reviews.Author: KentlassanCo
Reviews.Content: On reading other reviews we feel we were very lucky to have Room 7 (Queen Victoria Suite) as we had only booked a double room. Found this hotel very clean with helpful staff, comfortable beds and lovely modern en-suite, yes the breakfast room is a little unusual but serves it's purpose very well when you remember this is a budget hotel and not The Ritz. Our only bugbear (but not the hotels fault) was the outside street noise at night. We had 2 people sitting on the steps talking and laughing at 1.30 am in the morning that woke us up, then while trying to get back to sleep around 20 minutes later we heard a large heavy suitcase being wheeled along the pavement outside, but of course you could sort this problem with a good pair of ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Shaikh_Clan
Reviews.Content: Locality of the hotel was ideal for commuting, the modern decor and cosy beds added to the comfort of the room. Although the hotel was undergoing refurbishment, this did not cause any disturbance or distraction to me and my family. An excellent all-round break.

Reviews.Title: “Change of Heart!”
Reviews.Author: TimmahF
Reviews.Content: Our initial expectation was very poor, however put in context it wasn't all that bad. Horrid flight from DBX, had issues with the trains, so exhausted and not knowing how London streets work... we came to the hotel in a very bad mood. We had seen before we left for holidays the hotel wasn't rated great and with that in mind, we didn't like it... well for the first day. The staff were very helpful, kind and accommodating. They are doing loads of renovations... the room had a tv, desk, kettle, lovely bathroom with good hot water. The rooms are small but that should be expected in London at budget. It is quite close to central station and the start of all the tourist routes. Our main negative was the heat and no fan. We recommend the hotel but hey... it's not the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Expect tiny room with no luggage space ...”
Reviews.Author: jan155019
Reviews.Content: Rooms are tiny and really only suitable for small people with no luggage. No wardrobe (a few hangers) and one tiny drawer. Nowhere to put anything in shower stall. No luggage room - you have to leave luggage in small lobby chained up "at owner's risk". Reno materials around the place.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: Marty999
Reviews.Content: My wife booked this hotel for us to stay two nights on 7th and 8th May. We actually stayed as part of a group of 6 (3 rooms) and we went on a package deal, primarily to see a show for our friend's 50th birthday weekend. After telling me the name of the hotel I looked it up on Trip Advisor and was rather disappointed by the reviews on the site, but we were pleasantly surprised to find a major refit taking place. The reception was piled high with bathroom fittings and tiles when we checked in, and found that disconcerting, and they remained there for the duration of our stay. This also meant that fewer sofas and armchairs were available to sit upon. The bedrooms were actually very good as they were effectively brand new, with newly fitted carpets and bathrooms and the smell of fresh paint. The windows were old but that was not a problem. The room my wife and I had was on the top floor, and although the ceiling was slightly lower the floorspace was larger than the other two rooms on lower floors. We also had a view of the top of Big Ben and the London Eye. The breakfast room is situated in the basement so there was no natural lighting and this was a bit of a shame. The continental breakfast supplied was actually rather good, but don't be fooled into upgrading to a 'Cooked Breakfast' as all they give you is a Frankfurter sausage, fried egg and baked beans for Â£4.95 - not satisfactory! But overall we had a good stay thanks to the newly refurbished bedrooms, so for the money it's pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Cancelled reservation about information us”
Reviews.Author: martinkaq
Reviews.Content: We had a booking in Victoria Inn hotel. First booking we unfortunately couldnâ€™t use because our flight was canceled in terms of volcanic eruption (2010, April 15 â€“ 17) - anyway hotel took from us 138 pounds for unused service, however, I can understand the policy. Nice step from their side was that their offered to us one night for free if we stay in the hotel next time, we did booking again for May 6- 8 and the hotel promised to us cover first night expenses and payment for second night would be 79 pounds. We agreed to accept the offer and reservation from their side was CONFIRMED. When we arrived to Victoria Inn hotel on 6th of May we were really surprised and disappointed when receptionist informed us that our reservation is cancelled and we have to look for another hotel. Disappointment is even bigger because they didnâ€™t let us know that there is a problem with our reservation and they are going to cancel it. We needed to find another hotel after 10 pm with our entire luggage. Receptionist suggested for us to walk from hotel to hotel and find new accommodation how we want, she wasnâ€™t helpful at all, she didnâ€™t explain much why our booking is canceled and more over she was telling that most probably we will have big difficulties to find something because most of hotels are fully booked for this weekend! Ridiculous! I would not recommend this hotel to anybody, I have never saw similar behaviour.

Reviews.Title: “don't expect much”
Reviews.Author: derkio
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel as the pictures on the internet looked very good. The camera definitely lies. We had room 4 which was in the basement and was small and tatty, the shower/toilet cubicle was extremely tiny and worn looking. Also the toilet leaked and we told the hotel about it on our way out for the day when we came back all they had done was turn the tap to the cistern off which we had to turn back on when we used the toilet. The toilet was also loose and came away from the wall when you sat on it. Breakfast was supposed to be until 9.30 - on the last day we went in at 9.10 and were rudely told we had to be quick because breakfast was finished - at 9.20 they rudely told us and another group of people that we had to leave as they were locking the doors - i know it was a budget hotel but i don't think staff should be rude and unhelpful. non of the staff were english and complaining falls on deaf ears. they also advertise internet which we thought was free but you have to pay for it at Â£1.00 per 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Me and my girlfriend stayed a night in...”
Reviews.Author: RichardWiggett
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed a night in this hotel for valentines day. We stayed on the second floor room 26. The room was clean and tidy with a large basic tv great for watching the olympics and rugby before a night on the town. The room had tea and coffee making facilities. The bathroom was a bg old fashioned but clean and a nice running shower. The staff on the desk where friendly and helpful. The breakfast room was small and a bit tight for space but ok. The breakfast was just toast and cereal but ok to start you off before you can get something in town. It was walking distance to the tube station and a couple of shops. The lift wasn't scarry well not for me I am 24 in fact it was funny. It's not a hilton but for the money it's worth it and with so much to see and do in London you hardly want to spend time stuck in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Low price lower standards”
Reviews.Author: valentine66
Reviews.Content: Traveller beware, I stayed here in room 24,I was greeted by a room 10 feet long by 4 feet wide , cigarette burns in the carpet, tv remote held together with tape, mould in the shower, single glazed window screwed shut, toilet seat cracked. Dot not judge the hotel by their flattering pictures, this is not a true representation of what I experienced. If you want low budget , low standards then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: LAtrotamundo
Reviews.Content: The room definitely didn't look like the one shown on the hotel website. Generally I was disappointed because the hotel description on the hotel website was a bit different than reality. The building is quite old. Actually, everything in this hotel is old. The elevator is VERY old ... quite scary. What I didn't like was the place they serve breakfast. It was extremely small, there wasn't enough place for all the people, no matter what time would you come. So we had to wait for a free table. Plus it was really uncomfortable eating in such crowded place, making queue to a toaster ! There is no place you can leave your luggage (if you already check out), if you like you can tide it up to the radiator !Oh, and the bathroom was very small, I'm 1m77 and I could touch the roof with my head. The location is very good, especially if you plan to take a bus from the airport (all the buses go to Victoria Station which is very close to the hotel). The staff was nice and helpful. Our room was clean. It wasn't expensive, but I think a bit too expensive, considering the quality (but I guess London generally is expensive). It's a good choice if you go to London to visit a lot of places, and look for a hotel to sleep in only.

Reviews.Title: “This was NOT what I expected”
Reviews.Author: iopiui
Reviews.Content: just give a look to the photos.. Dirty dirty dirty and old. The bathroom ( I mean.. the bathroom room itself) was in PLASTIC,even the "floor". I had never seen a thing like that before in my life. I am still looking for the stars.. 3??? 3 stars?? NO way. Breakfast was rediculous . staff unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Spartan room but cheap and clean and a good price.”
Reviews.Author: LostMyTravelGuide
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights there toward the end of September. It was clean and quiet and the staff was friendly and helpfull. Slept well every night. Breakfast is not so good. Next time I will not bother and just go out somewhere for breakfast. Great location. Easy walk to many London sights and tube stations. Easy to get to from Gatwick. I will be going back as soon as I can afford another UK holiday and will probably spend a week.

Reviews.Title: “GRAT HOTEL FOR PRICE AND LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: brentb
Reviews.Content: Well,can't understand the bad reviews.We stayed 9 days.The room was clean and tidy.Room cleaned every day.All staff were friendly and helpfull.Location was great. Price was really reasonable-we got an advance internet rate of 60 pounds per night which is hard to beat in london.Yes rooms are small but this is london .To all that complain about the rooms well try and getting any bigger.You can but at triple the price.Try Easy jet paddington and then you will have something to whinge about. Breakfast was good-all you need to start the day-choice of 3 cereals,canned fruit,juice,toast and coffee/tea.The breakfast room was small and sometimes there was a wait but it wasn't that bad. Bathroom was also small but was workable and not that bad. We have stayed at other london budget B& B and this was the best so far-it seems to us that those who complain expect far too much from a budget B&B in London and really can't have stayed at others otherwise they would have realised that this is in fact a reallyn good B& B for the price and location. We would stay here againn and recommend this to anyone looking for a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Good: location, clean Bad: tiny, no frills”
Reviews.Author: C_Bristol
Reviews.Content: We got a room at Â£80 to go to a gig at brixton academy. The location was round the corner from pimlico station and the room was clean. It was however, about the size of a ferry or train overnight room, and the bathroom/wetroom was so small you could pee and take a shower at the same time. Could be as we got the very top room, so it was an attic room. Good for one night where you have to stay over - a bit depressing if you took a holiday there! View was nice - could see milennium wheel. Breakfast ok , nothing facny, cearal and toast. Coffee was not coffee, but we got one elsehwhere after.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best”
Reviews.Author: PrincessZeltron
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth trip to London and this was definitely not the best room I've had, even at the same price level. I'm used to small rooms, but the bathroom was akin to a Port-a-Potty. Some of the bathrooms in the photos on this site are nice compared to what I had. My bedroom window was held shut with a piece of rope; doesn't breed a feeling of security. I didn't bother with the breakfast room as it was in the basement, tiny, cramped with tables and chairs and frankly at 8am the last thing I wanted to do was squash myself at a table with people I don't know to fight over bad coffee and the same croissants you're going to get at every hotel of this calibre. Walk along Denbeigh / Wilton and go to Cafe Nero for great coffee and croissants if that's what you're looking for. The staff were very friendly and knowledgable about the area. They also knew early in the morning of any interruptions on the Tube which was very handy. There was someone at the front desk 24hrs a day which was nice. The location is great once you find your way from Victoria Station. I recommend walking along Wilton all the way to Belgrave. There are some great restaurants along there. One that I really liked was Gran Paradiso (Italian). Pimlico Station is also really close, maybe a bit closer than Victoria. The worst part about this hotel was having to listen to the other travellers who seem to feel the need to slam their doors and laugh and yell at the top of their lungs at all hours. Other than that the hotel was clean, in a good neighbourhood and the staff were great.

Reviews.Title: “"Tired old hotel"”
Reviews.Author: k_kMunster
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay in this hotel for 4 nights and it wasn't very nice. The hotel is very much like a B & B from 20 years ago, the decor is very tired and the layout of the building is very poor.Our double room was so small that I had to bend my head to avoid hitting off the TV when I wanted to get into bed! The bathroom was a converted closet, I've seen bigger on a small boat! Breakfast was served in a very dark , windowless and airless room in the basement, even the cheese was beginning to melt..... I didn't find the staff on the front desk very helpful because when I complained about the room she asked me what did I expect in the centre of London? Needless to say we only stayed one night and move to the Premier Inn for the rest of our stay, which was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel - do not stay here.”
Reviews.Author: FergusGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Bathroom was converted cupboard with a shower basin and toilet. Staff are less than helpful and the claims of wi-fi access at Â£2 per hour are false (despite complaining of lack of wi-fi signal, staff refused to refund my money). When leaving the hotel for a short time, staff demanded your room key - apparently for fire purposes. Breakfast was poor - stale bread and cakes. Do not stay here if you can help it!

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: PeterCLee
Reviews.Content: A lobby. elevator. coffee and tea in room. breakfast included, great location, for London a good sized room, all for $120.00. A bargain. Walk to Victoria Station or Pimlico tube stop in a couple of minutes. After viewing many hotel rooms in the area, this one stood out. Very friendly and helpful staff at the desk.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: clairelou85
Reviews.Content: First of all, like almost everyone else has said, the location of this hotel is fantastic! Just a ten minute walk from Victoria station, and the theater's for Wicked and Billy Elliot. The room however, was tiny. I stayed in a twin with the beds arranged in a L shape, but the gap between them was very small and leaving even a pair of shoes lying about made the room look like a tip! The bathroom was small again, but had a bath and shower, which was surprisingly powerful. At first glance, the room and bathroom were clean, however I found that the toilet hadn't been flushed from the last guests(!) and my mum found some tissues under the bed. The staff were friendly but when you left you had to leave the room key at reception, which I wasn't particularly happy about. We were told this was for fire precautions. And speaking of fire precautions, the only fire exit we could find was at the bottom of a narrow flight of stairs. We were staying on the 3rd floor, and if anything happened while we were staying I don't see how we could have gotten out.

Reviews.Title: “great location, average stay”
Reviews.Author: Huggles_83
Reviews.Content: close to tube, only 10 minutes walk. Ok for a short stay. Rooms a bit small but it was clean and affordable so can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “OK for short stay in London”
Reviews.Author: ScreamingAbdabs
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel in May for one night with friend. Paid Â£30 each for a twin room at the hotel. Good location on belgrave road, near Victoria and Pimlico tube station. Found a good cafe on the way back to Victoria Station on left hand side of Wilton Road I think. We had breakfast there as alot cheaper than the Â£9 the Victoria was charging. Room was ok, 2 twin beds in it, clean sheets, the bathroom was like a submarine, it was reasonably clean though. Only criticism was the thin walls, we heard next door putting on their kettle and we could hear every single word they spoke. Someone above us decided to bang the floor everytime we spoke when we got in from our concert. We werent even talking that loud, which annoyed us. However, as it was only one night, and it was Â£30, it was just somewhere to rest our weary heads, so it did the job.

Reviews.Title: “What you pay is what you get! Don't get it.”
Reviews.Author: NL1982
Reviews.Content: For the most part, I can only confirm what other reviewers have already said: the location is great (close to tube, train station) and safe to walk around at night. The reception and breakfast room were ok: simple but clean. The hotel building has a very complex structure. I guess at a certain time they included the next door building because to reach our room (510 I think) we had to cross different stairs, going up and down again and through hallways which also funtion as fire escapes. But since we paid less than 30 EUR per double room per night it was a good bargain! However, I wished I had paid more. I looked at the photos of other visiters and they do not reflect what we encountered at all (maybe they have started some well-deserved renovations in some rooms?)! We stayed in the hotel with a party of 6 (3 double rooms) and probably my room was the worst: The room is smallish (European) but ok if there wasn't a huge KITCHEN (with stove, fridge, microwave and all) blocking half the room. Moreover, the legs of the bed and the closet were crooked. The bathroom is tucked away in a plastic closet-like construction. We had to leave the tap on for 5 minutes before warmish water came out and a few times the water even stopped during a shower. The nasty thing was every time my friend flushed the toilet, the waste water seemed to be bubbling out of the kitchen sink (which was less than 50 cm away from the bed). I guess the larger, nicer bathrooms with blue tiles on the photos are the shared ones. Conclusion: since we only paid peanuts for our 5 day stay we don't have any reason to complain. The trip was great and we only stayed in the hotel for short periods of time at night. However, if you're a bit keen on clean and safe rooms and showers with running hot water you might better consider something else.

Reviews.Title: “Room very cosy and a wee bit small, but we had a great stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: BeretBear28
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Victoria Inn for three nights and although we were a bit disappointed with the size of our room when we checked in, we soon got used to the size of it and it wasn't actually that bad once we'd put our case away. The room was very clean and it was serviced on a daily basis. Staff were incredibly friendly and were always very polite to us. The hotel was in a great location - we were only about three minutes from a tube station (Pimlico) - about 10 minutes from Victoria. Would stay here again! Great power shower!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: tallintheair
Reviews.Content: We chose this the Victoria Hotel mainly for the location. It's a couple of tube stops away from a number of theatres and we felt safe walking home late at night. As for the hotel I don't have any major complaints. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable, the food was edible and the staff were friendly. Yes the rooms aren't very big and the room where breakfast is served is quite small too but you get what you pay for, and considering the price the facilities were perfectly adequate.

Reviews.Title: “an average hotel with good price and great location”
Reviews.Author: Anka123123
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel from website offers taking into account location and price. It was as I expected it to be for this money. The people working there were nice wishing you a nice day every day. The rooms were clean and warm /it was February, so I was a bit afraid, but OK/. The bathroom was small but quite nice. Breakfast was OK and there was always a place to sit. Generally, I woudn't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Average experience in an average London hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Allie6640
Reviews.Content: Exactly what I was expecting. Being London, you can't have the same expectations for your money as in a smaller town. The room wasn't impossibly small. It was what was to be expected for a below average cost hotel room. I had enough room to move around. My kettle and bathroom weren't overly clean and I used a hostel sleeping sheet to be on the safe side. The bathroom would have been a bit of an issue had I not been travelling by myself, and I refused to use the shower. Staff were friendly and helpful. Overall, an average experience. Slightly better than a hostel with ensuite. Would consider staying again, however, would use a hostel instead to save money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not worth 3 stars”
Reviews.Author: Lucrecia_Marionette
Reviews.Content: The exterior of the hotel and the reception are both lovely - taken straight from the hotel website. After you get through the first door however, things go downhill. We had a groundfloor double room and the bed practically filled the room - the TV on a wall bracket had a huge "Mind Your Head!" sticker on the side to make the point. The "decor" was dated and the bed linen looked old and over-washed. The tea and coffee facilities consisted of a couple of cups and saucers, two teabags, two sachets of sugar and coffee. After a difficult and very cold trip through London, we arrived after midnight and needed a hot drink. However, there was no milk, and when I asked the receptionist for some, in broken English he explained that he didn't know about milk and he only worked there one night a week. The bedroom was very cold on account of a large, draughty single-glazed window which overlooked a surpringly nice little courtyard with tables and chairs for milder weather. The bathroom/wet room was a joke. It looked like someone had taken the single-mold plastic cubicle from a decommissioned ferry and stuck it in the corner of an already tiny room. It was a grim green colour, the metal fixtures were scummy and when you sat on the toilet, it came away from the wall with a loud, metallic "clunk" and threatened to fall off completely. Having worked in hospitality for a number of years, I can say with some confidence that this is not a 3* hotel. I have stayed in nicer 2* hotels with nicer staff, cooked breakfasts and well-kept rooms. While I don't doubt that the bedrooms you see in their website pictures do exist, I certainly didn't see any indication of such quality while I was there. Having said all that, the location is fantastic and after long days of travel and sight-seeing, the hotel does do a good line in comfotable beds. And when you're too tired to keep your eyes open, you don't tend to care so much about peeling paint and misspelt signs! There are better hotels to spend your money on in London, and if you can get anywhere near a tube station, proximity to the city centre is a moot point.

Reviews.Title: “Average experience”
Reviews.Author: CarolynnATL
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a NYE. This hotel is rated as a 3 star and I would agree but the rooms are nothing special. The staff were all pleasant, but the desk clerk did not remember our last name throughout our 6 night stay. The hotel is well maintained. The location is good for downtown London, and close to main city attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BigCheeeeese
Reviews.Content: Please give serious thought to booking a room at this hotel. Even if it is your only option think twice and then twice more. The only decent thing about this hotel is its location but that did not make up for the tiny, dirty room with stained bedding and dirty bathroom, which still had someones pubic hairs in the basin! The room was sold as a 'triple' but was smaller that every 'single' room I have ever stayed in. The breakfast amounted to a choice of toast, tinned fruit cocktail or a couple of cereals. The coffee was the strangest I had tasted. How this hotel can boast AA *** is beyond my comprehension. The person who awarded this grade to the hotel must have been blind I think. As stated in my title to this review...This hotel is disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “No no no if it-s not your only choice”
Reviews.Author: strega_bambina
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really poor. The location is ok, near Victoria Station and Pimlico Station. The street is nice and safe also at late night. I even saw a wild fox in a garden nearby. But the hotel is extremely poor. This was the only hotel available in the area, so we booked, but...... ouch! I WOULD HAVE RUN AWAY THE SAME MOMENT I ENTERED MY ROOM, IF POSSIBLE. But everything in the area was fully booked. The lobby is just fine, would need a renovation. But for sure is the best spot of the hotel. I started trembling when i first saw the key to the room, that was RIDICOLOUS, a piece of grey plastic with the room number written on it with a black marker.... i tried hard not to laugh in desperation. They showed us the way to our triple room, and the room was incredibly small! The bathroom was very small and poor. No free soaps or whatelse....The carpet of the room was old and little dirty, the wardrobe was just fine but i didn-t even try to put my clothes into it and the curtains and the bedspread were quite dirty, even if my mom said they were clean but old stained... don-t know.... I am always worried about bedbugs and looking at that room i was even more worried because it was so cheap, but luckily there wasn-t.... I complained immediately to the reception saying that i was disappointed. Their web site was all but what i found once there, but they couldn-t help except showing me another room, that was on the low ground floor, and was cold and a little bit smelly. We preferred staying in the original one. The breakfast the day after was ridicolous, 4 slices of bread and some marmelades.... No bisquits, no chocolate, no yoghurt or fruit, and the drinks were also poor, and the worst... no space where to sit, as the room was incredibly small, and the hotel fully booked. The following mornings we went to have breakfast at Starbucks nearby. Finally i want to say that even if the staff was very friendly and available, the hotel was horrible. The worst i-ve ever stayed in my whole life. It would need a complete renovation and a change of management, because the location is nice and could be a great small hotel. But probably they just don-t care. They get the money anyway.... I must say that also all the other hotels nearby except Sidney Hotel, Corona Hotel, BW Victoria, Easyhotel seemed very poor, so probably Victoria Inn was just average.... but still!!! We payed 280 pounds for 3 pax for 3 nights. Not so much for London, you would say, but i can tell you that it was far too much for what the hotel deserves. I hope this review to be read by the hotel management... COME ON!! SPEND SOME MONEY TO MAKE THAT A PLACE THAT CAN BE CALLED HOTEL!!!!! This is my honest opinion. I-m always a small budget traveller and really adjustable person, but really.... i-ve never found a so poor hotel!! I-ve got no picture to attach.... but guys, trust me!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a Kip”
Reviews.Author: love2travel005
Reviews.Content: This place is a dive. Steer well clear! The room I stayed in was a wardrobe. They advertise wifi access in the rooms but this is not available. Instead you have to pay Â£1 or Â£2 for 30min!! The room was dirty. A stag party couldn't have made it look any worse! The breakfast is awful - cereal with warm milk, rubbery croissants from s cheap supermarket and a squashed up dining area. Fair enough it is pretty close to victoria station and you can get around London very easily from there. However, for the price, the room where you expect to relax after a long day was worse than solitary confinement! Do yourself a favour - spend a little extra or stay a little further out of central London and book somwhere decent. Never again would I stay in this kip.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterKid
Reviews.Content: Reception staff I found to be pleasant enough. The room was clean and reasonably sized. The bathroom was a plastic pre-formed unit, that was beginning to show its age. My main beef with this hotel was the Continental (with a small 'c')Breakfast and the Breakfast room in particular. The room was TOTALLY inadequate for the number of guests staying there. Chairs and tables were crammed in and by 08.15 hours there was a queue to get in there - a totally rediculous situation. If you were unlucky enough to sit with your back to the bar/counter, then you had people pushing past you all the time - dreadful. I only had one brief encounter with the catering staff and that was when we got into trouble for arriving at 07.55 hrs the first morning of our stay. The lady did not seem to be the happiest person in London !!! I would not wish to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: MaryH13
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel for my husbands birthday and also brought along our son and his girlfriend. On arrival we were checked in but it took the receptionist 10 minutes to find our room as it had no number on the door and he was new to the job!! While our room (the best in the hotel we were told) was spacious enough, the bathroom was tiny ,our sons room was no more than a dog box with barely room to walk around the bed. Breakfast each morning was a nightmare. The dining area did not have enough seating,therefore we had to queue for about 10 minutes to sit down. But that was not the worst, at exactly 09.15am the catering staff closed the dining room door, locked up the tea/coffee machine, cleared away bread, milk etc.and by 09.25 were verbally abusing the guests, shouting at us to get out, breakfast is finished at 9.15. We were shocked to say the least and most guests left their unfinished breakfast behind. Then a cleaner came in with a hoover and proceeded to clean up. I was the only one of my family who dared to go down for breakfast for the next two mornings. The hotel is in a central location and reasonably priced but the rudeness of the catering staff totally cancelled out any asset. The experience ruined what should have been a Birthday celebration weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay with good location”
Reviews.Author: max-olive
Reviews.Content: After a long flight, this hotel is great because it is close to the Victoria Train Station. In fact this hotel is in a good location that is close to a lot of things to do, and it has a tube stop near by to get to everything else. Our group walked everywhere though. So I would be ready to walk no matter where you stay or be ready to use a lot of public transportation. As for the hotel, our room was actually large with 4 beds. The bathroom was a typical closet transformed into a water closet. The staff was friendly, but there was one guy who showed up at our room after we checked in to give a "tour" of our room. In reality, he was just looking for a tip. The room was clean and about what you expect from a good Europian hotel without spending tons of money.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: lunafly
Reviews.Content: From some of the reviews I had read I was a little afraid but I was pleasantly suprised. Room was small but that was expected for London. Good security, though no luggage storage after checkout other than in the lobby. Good breakfast. Clean - they cleaned the room every day. Walking distance to Victoria Station or bus right across the street. Would reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “basic and simple”
Reviews.Author: Stef443
Reviews.Content: We booked two hotel rooms 3 bed room and a 2 bed room. the 3 bedded room was very nice the bathroom was fine and the space was ok too. Also t.v. in room. The other room was strange. The ceiling was very high and the bathroom was horrid. It was like a cupboard which was changed into a bathroom. You had to step up into it and you could have a shower whilst on the toilet. Also we thought the breakfast times was a bit early and the dining area was tiny. The youth hostel nearby was fine. No trouble at all. Apart from that i would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money in a pretty good location.”
Reviews.Author: lancelotofwales
Reviews.Content: The hotel is basic but clean and tidy. The staff are really friendly and helpful. The rooms are small but not too cramped. Brreakfast is a basic continental, however, the breakfast room is far too small - we took our food outside on the patio and it was very relaxing and a good way to start the day. In summary, you get what you pay for in this world and if its cheap and cheerful then this is for you - if its luxury your after, then look elsewhere - I'd go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value, friendly”
Reviews.Author: gapthemind
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night -- April 15. Clean, efficient setting and rooms -- friendly and helpful staff. Our room was typical by London standards (read: cozy), on the 4th floor, facing Belgrave Street, comfortable and quiet. Use Pimlico tube station if you're pulling or carrying luggage -- Victoria is much farther. Good selection of reasonably priced restaurants nearby, mostly Indian and Pub. We would definitely stay at the Victoria Inn again. Above average for location, hotel category and room price. Victoria web site offers special pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Victoria Inn on Belgrave Rd- okay for a quick trip.”
Reviews.Author: surfsummer
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Victoria Inn while we were visiting London Fashion Weekend in Feb. The hotel was in a pretty good location - we got the train straight from Heathrow airport to Victoria station (get the southern train, NOT the heathrow express, it costs twice as much!) and hotel was only a 10min walk max from station. Located in a very nice area, street was lovely and pretty quiet at night. Hotel was a bit of a disapointment if you are expecting any luxury! Run by what i think must have been a polish family- Room was very small, but this is to be expected of any hotel in the area. It seemed clean enough and we didn't get bothered with any noise at all. I had read a couple of other reviews that said the hotel was really hot & windows didnt open - however we had a fine temp in the room and window worked just fine! the little lift was very handy for getting luggage up and down. Bathroom was what can only be described as a pod- bit grimy round the edges but otherwise fine. Breakfast was a big let-down - although we were a bit hungover when we showed up for it! Give it a miss if your a bit paranoid! The breakfast room was a tiny windowless 1970's basement cupboard that smelled of old burnt toast. Stick to hot chocolate and a chewy croissant...! Didnt use the tube at nearby Pimlico as was really expensive. Got the bus straight to leicester Sq from bus stop across the road from hotel- really handy 24hr service & cheap too! Wouldn't go back as realised easyhotel was on the same street and looked a lot nicer - same price.

Reviews.Title: “My Stay At The Victoria Inn.”
Reviews.Author: mobile_6
Reviews.Content: I checked into the Victoria Inn,London for a one night stay on Saturday 26th January.Everything at check-in went well with no problems and i was soon into my room which was on the first floor.The room was very small,however as i was on my own it was big enough for me.The bathroom was like a little box room as you had to up 1 step to get inside.Shower very small though. {There is more room in a telephone kiosk}.This is the second hotel i have checked into within the past 5 months which had this style of bathroom,like a little box.I find them unacceptable but for staying in a cheap hotel this is what you get. The tea/coffee making facilities are ok,but only as long as you don't mind using powdered milk.I do mind. I found it unusual to be asked to hand over my key card at reception when i was going out for the evening,maybe the clerk thought i was'nt coming back again! The breakfast period only lasts for 1 hour between 8/9am,so it was no surprise that the small breakfast room,located in the basement,became very crowded after just 20 minutes.It was self-service with juice,cereals,and brown/white bread,with a toaster provided.There was a hot drinks machine available which supplied chocolate drink and coffee,but no tea.There did'nt seem to be any cooked breakast available,but as i never eat a cooked breakfast this did'nt matter to me.I did'nt see any ventilation in the room and it quickly beame very stuffy with so many people seated.I'm glad i went for breakfast at 8am exactly because within a very short time there was a queue at the self-service counter,which was very small.On leaving the room there were 2 people standing outside in the hallway waiting for a table.I would recommend that the breakfast period be extended by 1 hour,{7.30am to 9.30am would be ideal} which would stop everyone coming at once,and the room would not feel as stuffy either.It should therefore be possible for everyone to get a table and no one will have to wait in the corridor. Check-out for me went very well and was just a matter of handing over my key card as i had paid my bill on arrival.It is the first time i have ever checked out of a hotel where i was not handed a hotel receipt for my stay,usually from a printer,so i left empty-handed.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: nurseynursey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my hoppo before an Amy Whino gig. Its just down the road from victoria station with a few pubs inbetween for a swift half if you fancy it! Generally good location but there are some of these B&B type places all up the road and therefore some located nearer to the station. It was cheap as chips and was perfect for a non romantic night in the city. Theres everything you need and even a free brekkie to top it all off. Can't really add much else, wasn't really any frills to mention. Go here if you're looking for cheap and reliable, but not one to impress the ladies on valentines x

Reviews.Title: “Victoria Inn was fine.”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller200753
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Victoria Inn twice - Sept. 2004, May 2006. Each time I was with a different person. Yes, the rooms are small but we were out sightseeing most of the time. Considering the costs of hotels in London, this inn was a bargain!!!

Reviews.Title: “No sleep”
Reviews.Author: MzLadybug
Reviews.Content: This hotel room was VERY small and the bed was very uncomfortable. If you want to be cool at night, do not even CONSIDER opening your bedroom window. There is a youth hostel next door, and apparently all the kids that stay there can afford to do is to stay out on the street and drink and cut up all night. The hotel staff say that there is nothing they can do. The youth do not leave the street until about 4 in the morning. The Breakfast does not change, and is in a VERY hot basement with no ventilation. We will not return to this hotel. For the money that we paid, the bathrooms in a power boat are bigger than at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: DLTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Victoria Inn while travelling on our honeymoon and unless you are completely desperate strongly recommend you find somewhere else to stay. The nightmare started when we booked in after 23 hours of travel to find we had been allocated a twin share room - despite being very specific in all correspondence about it being our honeymoon! We were informed there was nothing that could be done as no other rooms were available. The next day we were moved to the only available double room that was in the basement and was so small not enough room to open our suitcase and had no ventilation. On the third day we were moved yet again to room 6 which was (admittedly) a reasonable room. The manager of the hotel is the rudest person we have ever had to deal with for a customer service complaint and agree with your other reviewers that she should not be working in the customer service industry. When we complained about having been allocated a twin room she was very agressive, raised her voice at us and told us it was too bad and if we didn't like it we could get out of her hotel. We could not believe the size and standard of all the bathrooms (after having 3 different rooms we are able to comment on a variety of them)! The showers are so small you had to stand like a tin soldier once you were in, water was always covering the floor, and the toilets are very tightly squeezed in. The breakfast room was also the worst we have experienced. There was no ventiliation so it was really hot and stuffy and it was constantly overcrowded with nowhere to sit. The food was of a very average standard - basic toast, cereal and tinned fruit. On a positive note we found the cleaning staff really friendly and a couple of the front desk people also nice. The location of the hotel was quite central being a short walk to a couple underground stations. It was however very unusual that we were required to hand in our key at reception every time we left the hotel??? I am absolutely baffled as to how this hotel manages to keep it's star rating as it certainly does not compare in any way to any other hotel we have stayed in. The favourite part of our stay was definitely checking out! Do yourself a favour and find somewhere else to stay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “look elsewhere! NASTY”
Reviews.Author: hgebauer
Reviews.Content: We arrived and the lobby looked nice and clean. When we got to our rooms we were shocked at how small they were. The rooms were clean, but hadn't been painted in a long time and looked more like a college dorm than a hotel room. The place charges for internet acces (you can find a free hotspot if you browse around). It also offers breakfast, when we went down to breakfast it was like 1OOdegrees down there and smelled like something was burning. So, we had to go elsewhere. The bathrooms are deplorable. They smell like sewers and don't even have doors on their showers! STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to stay in....”
Reviews.Author: mefinally
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located, and I saw this hotel by searching on the internet with words like "budget hotels in central london" and it's the truth, very centrally located. Close to Station, restaurant, Theatre and Attractions such as Buckingham Palace. I recommend this hotel to everyone, apart from the reception lady who can be moody, I liked the staff, very friendly, the hotel is clean and nice and offers great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, smelly rooms with even smaller bathrooms - you can find a better hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kleighg
Reviews.Content: The room we had was very small - a full size bed barely fit and the bathroom...what a joke! Imagine an airplane bathroom with a tiny shower. They keep your key when you leave - not sure why they insisted on this, but they did! You stand in a line for a breakfast that consists of toast and cereal in the smallest dining room I've ever seen! It was also very loud! The location was ideal, but there are tons of other options on the same road!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place!”
Reviews.Author: LonelyDragon
Reviews.Content: I am frankly extremly suprised by how many bad reviews this place has gotten. I was not expecting much considering the price, but I was very pleasantly surprised. The location is fantastic, the rooms were cheerful and clean, and the staff were friendly. I would reccomend this place to anyone, and I'm someone who usually stays in fairly nice hotels. The bathrooms were small and very clean, although the shower was a bit finicky. The only thing I was really disapointed in was the breakfast. It was quite meagre, jusy three cerial choices and some toast and jam, but I shouldn't have expected more for the price. The beds were comfortable and there were small tea pots in the rooms which was really nice. There is also a computer you can pay a pound or two to use in the lobby. This place was really lovely overall. I noticed no smoke smell; perhaps this has been improved since other reviewers were there. If you're looking for a hotel where people wait on you head and foot and overcharge you for amenties you don't need, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO”
Reviews.Author: Corde
Reviews.Content: Terrible Hotel Photos on the there website were very missleading Rooms were small and all rooms are smoking rooms so even if you request non smoking it is not guarenteed. I was staying in the hotel with 2 other friends, 1 of the girls was given a ground floor room with no lock on the window & when she asked to move she was told there was nothing available. My room the door did not lock & the 3rd room was so small you could hardly move. All 3 rooms were freezing Staff were very unfriendly & when we called to get directions to the hotel they could not help other than to tell us what street the hotel was on.

Reviews.Title: “cheap but not so cheerful”
Reviews.Author: trapsy
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 night stay at The Victoria Inn. It was our first stay in London, so didn't really know what to expect. From the photo's on the website, it looked like a very nice hotel, with decent sized rooms, with nice spaceous en-suite bathrooms. Our room (No 37), was on the 4th floor, so had to use the 'lift' to get there. Once we got into the room, we were very disappointed. The 'en-suite' was basically a porta-cabin in the corner of the room. The door opened outwards as there was so little space in it! The 'shower' was a very small triangle, and the water went everywhere. This left the toilet, the sink and the floor very wet and slippery. The room overall was tiny, but clean. On the first morning of our stay, we went down for breakfast (in the basement). There was a queue to get in as the room was so small, and couldn't properly cater for the number of guests staying there. After a 10 minute wait and still no seats, we left the hotel and went elsewhere for breakfast. The next morning, we didn't even bother going down there. The positive aspect of staying here is the location. It is just a 10 minute walk to Victoria Tube / Train station. It is ideally located to explore the city, and the public transport network in the area is great. Overall, great location, not so great accommodation. Wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “unpleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: rexbo
Reviews.Content: The room (#24) was very small; basically the gap from bed (small also) to the walls was 1 foot on one side, and approx. 2 feed on other side. (see picture of the entire room) The bed cover was full of stains (see picture). I don't think that anyone would risk to use the water glass in the bathroom (see picture). The shower was like a coffin; one couldn't move, once under the shower. the staff didn't look too professional, and seemed unaware of the fact that they have to produce bills when one checks out. Plus: proximity to Buckingam Palace (approx. 25-30 min. walk)

Reviews.Title: “Dont go there...”
Reviews.Author: AJK83
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, grim and stink of stale smoke. Our room had a delightful damp patch on the wall which seemed to grow by the minute. The bed consisted of a saggy mattress, one measly pillow, and a dubious brown quilt that probably hadn't been washed since Queen Victoria was on the throne. The bathroom reminded me of a portaloo at a music festival, and the "complimentary toiletries" amounted to a caustic soap more commonly found in a public toilet. The continental breakfast was served in a windowless, stuffy holding cell in the basement, and amounted to some toast, chemical jam, and uninspiring cereal. I didn't even venture near the brown liquid that was pretending to be coffee. There are better hotels in London, I'm sure that there cant be many that are worse!

Reviews.Title: “Awful- Truly A Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: Creativelolita
Reviews.Content: This place is deceiving--the lobby looks nice but it's a total dump. You get the impression from the rooms that they rent by the hour. The beds are scary and the room smelled. I was concerned about the cleanliness and the bathroom (entire bathroom) was the size of the shower. You bathed nearly on top of the toilet). The "shampoo" was hand wash in a wall dispenser. The breakfast they serve is bread and bad coffee. I would never, ever, ever recommend this hotel. It was awful, dingy and the service was below average.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean ”
Reviews.Author: rmcl26
Reviews.Content: Some of the reviews made me a little nervous, but we booked it anyhow due to price and location. Upon arrival they took us next door to a partner hotel, Victor Inn. They've taken a standard size bedroom in an older building and built a bathroon inside the room. Therefore the room is very very small, as is the bathroom. However, both were very clean and adequate if you're in need of a place to sleep, and not planning on spending all day in the room. The location is great. You can walk to the hotel for the Victoria station, which is a major train and metro station. You can also walk to most of the tourist attractions.

HotelInfo.Name: Victoria Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 65-67 Belgrave Road | Victoria, London SW1V 2BG, England
